info.title: Payment Service
info.description:
# Introduction

The Dojo API is RESTful. It returns HTTP response codes to indicate errors. It also
accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body. 

# Authentication


# HTTP Responses

The API returns HTTP responses on each request to indicate the success or otherwise of API requests. The various HTTP status codes we might return are listed below.

| Code  | Title | Description |
|---------|----------------|----------------|
|200| OK | The request was successful. |
|400| Bad request | Bad request, probably due to a syntax error. |
|401| Unauthorized | 	Authentication required. |
|402| Request Failed | Over plan quota on this endpoint. |
|404| Not found | The resource does not exist. |
|405| Method Not Allowed| The used request method is not supported by that resource, e.g. using a POST on a resource that requires a GET.
|409| Conflict | The request could not be completed because it conflicted with another request or the server's configuration. |
|50X| Internal Server Error | An error occurred with our API.|

# Errors

Dojo follows the error response format proposed in [RFC 7807](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807) also known as Problem Details for HTTP APIs. All errors are returned in the form of JSON.

## Error Schema

In case of an error, the response object contains the following fields: 

| Field | Type| Required| Description |
|---------|----------------|----------------|---------------|
|errors| Object || Returns an explanation of errors.|
|type| String || Returns the type of error that was encountered.|
|title| String|| Returns a short summary of errors. |
|status| Integer | | Returns the HTTP status code.|
|traceId| String ||The unique identifier of the failing request.|

The following example shows a possible error response:

``` json
{
    "errors": {
        "Reference": [
            "The Reference field is required."
        ]
    },
    "type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1",
    "title": "One or more validation errors occurred.",
    "status": 400,
    "traceId": "00-a405f077df056a498323ffbcec05923f-aa63e6f4dbbc734a-01"
}
```


# Versioning

Dojo API uses the YYYY-MM-DD API version-naming scheme. You have to pass the version as the `version` header in all API calls.

When we make [breaking changes](../development-resources/versioning-overview/#breaking-changes) to the API, we release new dated versions. 

The current version is 2021-10-22. Check the last updates out in the [changelog](../development-resources/versioning-overview/#changelog).

# Postman collection

You can run the API collection in Postman:

[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/16735701-7fe64908-9da4-4c17-b78d-80a1f41b4295?action=collection%2Ffork&collection-url=entityId%3D16735701-7fe64908-9da4-4c17-b78d-80a1f41b4295%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3Dfdd152df-0154-428c-aeb4-1b90e46b8523)

tags.name: Payment intents
tags.description:
Allows you to take and manage payments.

**Documentation**: [Payments](../payments)

tags.name: Refunds
tags.description:
Allows you to manage a refund for payments.

**Documentation**: [Refunds](../payments)

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a payment intent.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

delete.description: Cancels a payment intent. The payment intent can be canceled if it is in the `Created` status. After cancellation, the payment intent will change the status to `Canceled` and any operations on the payment intent will fail with an error.

post.description: Captures a payment intent that has previously been created but not yet refunded or reversed. You can capture the full amount or a partial amount.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

get.description: Retrieves the status of a previously created payment intent.

post.description:
Retrieves a list of payment intents.
Results are paginated, by default the method returns only up to 50 payment intents.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

post.description: Changes tips amount for a payment intent. Available only if you allowed tips when creating this payment intent.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

post.description: Changes the amount for a payment intent. Available only if you allowed the amount changes when creating this payment intent.
Sends a receipt to the email addresses you specified.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

post.description: Creates a refund. Refund allows you to return a payment that has previously been created but not yet refunded. You can refund the full amount or a partial amount.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

parameters.name: idempotencyKey
parameters.description: An optional idempotency key to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. How you generate the idempotency key is up to you. Must be unique for each new refund for the payment intent.

200.description: Returns the CreateRefundResponse object if the refund succeeded.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a refund that has previously been created.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

200.description: Returns the Reversal object if the reversal succeeded.

amount.description: The amount to capture. You can capture the full amount or a partial amount.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

transactionSource.description: Information regarding the transaction source type.

connecteTokenExpirationDate.description: The date that the Connect-e token will expire.

paymentMethods.description: The payment methods that customers can use to pay.

amount.description: The amount intended to be collected by this Payment intent.

requestedAmount.description: The amount that was requested by this Payment intent.

totalAmount.description: The total amount after applying discounts and taxes.

billingAddress.description: The address where to send the invoice.

shippingDetails.description: The address where to send the order.

reference.description: Details of the reference for the payment.

subtotalLineItems.description: The total amount after applying discounts and taxes..

itemLines.description: The line items purchased by the customer.

taxLines.description: The taxes applied to the items.

actionLink.description: The link to the checkout page.

config.description: Details about the payment intent configuration.

paymentSource.description: Information regarding the payment source type.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can use for storing additional information.

TransactionSource.description: `MOTO` if the source of the transaction is mail or phone. Otherwise, this field is null.
TransactionSource.title: TransactionSource

PaymentIntentStatus.description: Current status of the payment intent.
PaymentIntentStatus.title: PaymentIntentStatus

transactionDateTime.description: The date and time of the payment in [ISO 8601 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

expiryDate.description: The expiry month and year. Format: MM/YY.

address2.description: Address line 2 (for example, street, apartment, or suite).

city.description: City, town, district, suburb, or village.

locality.description: Locality, can use in addition to city.

PaymentIntentConfig.description: Details about the payment intent configurations.
PaymentIntentConfig.title: PaymentIntentConfig

title.description: The title of the payment intent.

redirectUrl.description: The URL where the customer will be directed to after the payment.

cancelUrl.description: The URL where the customer will be directed to when cancelling the payment.

customerEmail.description: Configuration of the client's email address.

collectionRequired.description: If has the value `true` the object will be collected.

showTotal.description: If has the value `true` the total will be showed.

captureMode.description: The type of capture for the payment.

amount.description: The amount intended to be collected by this Payment intent.

reference.description: The details of the reference for the payment.

billingAddress.description: The address where to send the invoice.

shippingDetails.description: The address where to send the order.

transactionSource.description: Information regarding the transaction source type. `MOTO` if the source of the transaction is mail or phone. Otherwise, this field is null.

config.description: Details about the payment intent configurations.

itemLines.description: The details of the line items purchased by the customer.

taxLines.description: The taxes applied to the items.

actionLink.description: The link to the payment's associated actions.

paymentSource.description: Information regarding the payment source type.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can use for storing additional information.

paymentIntentId.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

previousTransactionId.description: Unique identifier for the previous transaction.

paymentSource.description: Information regarding the payment source type.

startDate.description: Date and time from which to search in [ISO 8601 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

endDate.description: Date and time until which to search in [ISO 8601 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)..

cursor.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

Cursor.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to be returned in a single page.

before.description: A cursor for use in pagination for the previous page. `before` and `after` are mutually exclusive - only one of these may be used.

after.description: A cursor for use in pagination for the next page. `before` and `after` are mutually exclusive - only one of these may be used.

before.description: A cursor for use in pagination for the previous page.

after.description: A cursor for use in pagination for the next page.

PaymentMethod.description: The payment methods that customers can use to pay.

value.description: The amount in the minor unit, for example "100" for 1.00 GBP.

CaptureMode.title: CaptureMode
CaptureMode.description: The type of capture for the payment.

address.description: The address where to send the order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the line item.

quantity.description: The quantity of items being purchased.

amountTotal.description: The total amount before applying discounts and taxes.

ActionLink.title: ActionLink
ActionLink.description: The link to the payment's associated actions.

label.description: Custom label given to the action.

ActionType.title: ActionType
ActionType.description: The type of action associated with the link.

collectionRequired.description: If has the value `true` the object will be collected.

customAmountAllowed.description: If has the value `true` the amount of the payment intent can be changed.

tipsAllowed.description: If has the value `true` tips are allowed.

collectionRequired.description: If has the value `true` the object will be collected.

amount.description: The amount intended to be collected by this Payment intent.

emails.description: The list of email addresses to which the receipt should be sent.
